context_of_use: This use case allows customers to manage their orders by adding products to their cart, checking out, tracking orders, and allows managers to approve orders.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to manage orders efficiently
manager: wants to ensure timely order approvals
description: This use case supports adding products to a cart, checking out, tracking orders, and approving orders.
preconditions: Customer is logged into the system.
postconditions: Products are added to the cart.
Orders are approved by the manager.
assumptions: The customer has a valid account.
The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to add products to their cart.
The system shall allow customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall allow customers to track their orders.
The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of payment methods supported.
main_flow: 1. Customer adds products to cart → System updates cart with selected products.
2. Customer proceeds to checkout → System displays checkout options.
3. Customer selects payment method and confirms order → System processes payment and confirms order.
4. Customer requests order tracking → System provides tracking information.
5. Manager reviews pending orders → System displays orders awaiting approval.
6. Manager approves order → System updates order status to approved.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): If the customer wants to browse products before checkout, they can select 'browse products' → System allows browsing of products.
AF-2 (from Step 3): If the payment fails, the system notifies the customer and prompts for a different payment method.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the product is out of stock, the system notifies the customer and prevents adding the product to the cart.
